content: the resist hat pattern notes your notes the resist hat is a unisex stranded colorwork hat with a seamless folded brim it s worked in the round in ribbing from a provisional cast-on after the brim is worked the provisional cast-on is taken out the brim is folded in half and stitches are knit together for a double-thick brim with an invisible join one increase row is worked before knitting the main body of the hat and working the stranded colorwork chart the crown is reduced without a chart there is a slight jog on the lettering at the start/end of each round which is only noticeable where the letters overlap the round the 2nd and 4th resist repeats and the 7th repeat on the size large as written in the charts to adjust for this you can try the following knit two rounds of mc stockinette between resist repeat row instead of one if knitting a size large follow chart a so your hat doesn t become too tall this gives your lettering a little more visual breathing room so any changes to the chart won t be as noticeable when you re coming up to a letter with an overlap like the letter e work the last stitch of that letter a round earlier than written in the chart my preferred provisional cast-on method is a crochet provisional cast-on ysolda teague has a helpful tutorial here http //blog ysolda com/2014/10/23/ technique-thursday-provisional-cast-on 04 the resist
